organization.fullName: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

identificationModule.briefTitle: Neural Circuit Effects of Ketamine in Depression
identificationModule.officialTitle: Neural Circuit-Specific Mechanisms of Ketamine's Effect on Anhedonia and Anxiety in Depression Using Ultra-High Field 7-Tesla MRI

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

leadSponsor.name: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This project is designed to examine the role of the subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC) in anhedonia and anxiety in humans with depression, as well as the acute and sustained effects of ketamine on agACC activation and depression symptoms.

armGroups.label: Ketamine
armGroups.description: Participants in the ketamine arm will receive a single infusion of ketamine

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Participants in the placebo arm will receive a single placebo infusion of normal saline

interventions.name: Ketamine
interventions.description: 0.5 mg/kg ketamine dissolved in 100 mL saline, delivered intravenously

primaryOutcomes.measure: sgACC response to the Incentive Flanker Task
primaryOutcomes.description: Subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC) response to reward measured by the BOLD (Blood Oxygen Level Dependent) signal within the sgACC region of the brain, during an fMRI Incentive Flanker Task in healthy controls and in adults with MDD. BOLD signal is the unit of measure of this outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Treatment-related change in sgACC response to the Incentive Flanker Task
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment-related change from baseline to 1-day post treatment in subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC) response to reward measured by the BOLD (Blood Oxygen Level Dependent) signal within the sgACC region of the brain, during an fMRI Incentive Flanker Task. MDD adults only.

overallOfficials.name: James Murrough, MD/PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

overallOfficials.name: Laurel Morris
overallOfficials.affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

locations.facility: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: All of the individual participant data collected during the trial, after deidentification.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Immediately following publication. No end date.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria:
Investigators whose proposed use of the data has been approved by an independent review committee ('learned intermediary') identified for this purpose.

Any purpose. Specify Other Mechanism Data from this study will be submitted to the National Institute of Mental Health Data Archive (NDA). The NDA is a data repository run by the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) that facilitates data sharing across mental health and other research communities. Periodically during and after study completion, the researchers will upload deidentified data information to the NDA. Other researchers nationwide can then file an application to obtain access to deidentified study data for research purposes.
